Posts.Content: Hi everyone My mum noticed she had an inverted nipple the other day she's 67 - she was born with one but this one has just appeared - so she went to the GP who gave her a physical exam under her arms and her breasts etc. He said he couldn't find anything else so told her to come back again in 3 months. With cancer being the way it is and time being of the essence when it comes to treatment. Is this normal to be told to come back in 3 months or should she have had further tests? It would be great if someone could offer any advice? Thanks on advance Roland
Posts.Title: breast cancer concern, inverted nipped , GP says comeback in 3 mo...

Posts.Content: Thanks Ladies for all your advice it's really appreciated. I was thinking the same but thought i would get some advice, so thanks for that. She's ringing her GP in the morning to make an appointment so hopefully they can refer her for some further tests. If i get any further significant news i'll update the thread. take care Roly
Posts.Title: breast cancer concern, inverted nipped , GP says comeback in 3 mo...

Posts.Content: understood, she's got anpointment early next week so i'll let her know. thanks again :) Enter your message...
